intro: Cardamine amara subsp. pyrenaea, commonly known as the Pyrenean bitter celandine, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its basal leaves with three to five lobes. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and rocky slopes. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct ecological and morphological adaptations compared to other Cardamine species.
